title: Building Modern Web Applications with Vuego
author: Jane Developer
intro: Vuego combines the simplicity of Vue.js-style templates with the power of Go's template engine. This article explores how to leverage both for building dynamic, server-rendered applications.

features.name: Server-Side Rendering
features.description: Render templates on the server for better SEO and initial load performance

features.name: Familiar Syntax
features.description: Use Vue.js-like directives (v-if, v-for, v-bind) that feel natural

features.name: Type Safety
features.description: Leverage Go's type system for robust template rendering

steps: Install Vuego package with go get
Create your first template with .vuego extension
Set up data as a map[string]any
codeExample:
vue := vuego.NewVue(templateFS)
var buf bytes.Buffer
err := vue.Render(&buf, "page.vuego", data)
